lexUnit.name: straggle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move along slowly so as to trail behind the person or people in front

sentence.text: One of the intruders was straggling some half mile behind the rest , so this was attacked by the newly-promoted Flt.Lt .
Some built sturdily of wood and iron , others no more than skins of plastic sheeting over frames of branches , they straggled north over the dunes as far as I could see .
And got heavier as they left the small station and straggled down a steep , cinder path .
They looked so filthy and disreputable that a woman walking her dog stopped to stare at them as they straggled wearily across the wide , almost deserted beach .
The breakfast things were still on the table ; the bedclothes lay tangled on the floor ; Tessa 's clothes straggled across the carpet from her open suitcase .
They straggled lamentably along the road , bent in two by the weight of their packs , streaming with water , and all this to go and become mashed to pulp in muddy trenches .
Straggling behind her was a small child , about four or five , O could n't see what sex the child was .
On the way the children straggled behind them or dived down lanes where archways blocked out the steadily mounting sun .

He was young , his blond hair straggling beneath an enormous cap , his stout body so stuffed into a French doublet that when he stood up in the stirrups ( to give himself height ) his coat bulged at the seams .
Oliver 's beach friends straggled into the café , grumbling at the abrupt change of weather .

Each morning the members of the team come straggling into the dark and dusty offices , yawning and inert ; and each morning , as coffee is brought round and work gradually gets under way , the little enclosed world comes alive .
In the corner by the window was a stringy plant straggling desperately out of a blurry brown pot , as if in search of water .
Odd hairs straggled out of various warts , and the brown freckles of age gave them a strange resemblance to the stones .
The passengers came straggling back shedding overcoats and saying it was cold outside , and again the dining car filled up .
Soon the rest of the girls would straggle in , the mail would arrive and another week would be under way .

Dickens regards the behaviour of Mr Guppy as ` usual " in people who go over houses : ` They straggle about in wrong places , look at wrong things , do n't care for the right things , gape when more rooms are opened , exhibit profound depression of the spirits , and are clearly knocked up . "

Some of them straggled back through Taunton , and being in no hurry to get home settled down in the Floral Gardens , playing guitars and tambourines , smoking joints , dropping acid and chanting mantras .
From spring 1878 onwards , several small groups of these homesick exiles straggled back to the Lapwai Reservation .
